001package imagingbook.pub.morphology;
002
003import ij.IJ;
004import ij.process.Blitter;
005import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
006import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
007
008public class BinaryDilation extends BinaryMorphologyFilter {
009        
010        public BinaryDilation() {
011                super();
012        }
013                        
014        public BinaryDilation(byte[][] H) {
015                super(H);
016        }
017        
018        public void applyTo(ByteProcessor ip) {
019                //assume that the hot spot of H is at its center (ic,jc)
020                int xc = (H[0].length - 1) / 2;
021                int yc = (H.length - 1) / 2;
022                int N = H.length * H[0].length;
023                
024                ImageProcessor tmp = ip.createProcessor(ip.getWidth(), ip.getHeight());
025                
026                int k = 0;
027                IJ.showProgress(k, N);
028                for (int j = 0; j < H.length; j++) {
029                        for (int i = 0; i < H[j].length; i++) {
030                                if (H[j][i] > 0) { // this element is set
031                                        // copy image into position (u-ch,v-cv)
032                                        tmp.copyBits(ip, i - xc, j - yc, Blitter.MAX);
033                                }
034                                IJ.showProgress(k++, N);
035                        }
036                }
037                ip.copyBits(tmp, 0, 0, Blitter.COPY);
038        }
039
040}
